intro: Paralasianthus lowianus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in grassland and savanna habitats, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, cylindrical fruit capsules that contain numerous seeds. Paralasianthus lowianus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
